parameters: \pop[2]My first instinct is to imbibe in the whiskey that everyone's been sharing.
\pop[2]But I feel like I need a clear head to process everything that's going on.
\pop[2]I'd describe the aura of our group as a mix of denial, and optimism.
\pop[2]We didn't really know what was happening back in Toronto. We could only guess.
\pop[2]But everyone's deductions were logical. We'd be safer if that drive was destroyed.
\pop[2]I wonder what kind of secrets \c[10]Argus\c[0] was hiding. Something called Panopticon?
\pop[2]If I had any reception, I'd search it up. But there's none to be found.
\pop[2]Life without a working phone seems terrible. I feel so vulnerable.
Thought I'd come see what's up.
\i[3]"Just trying to process everything. It's a lot."
\i[3]"Just trying to process everything. It's a lot."
I'm sorry for panicking back at the HQ, by the way.
\i[3]"I'd say that was definitely panic worthy."
\i[3]"I'd say that was definitely panic worthy."
I didn't know what to expect from today, but it wasn't \c[14]that\c[0].
\pop[3]Until today, she only existed inside of my vision.
\pop[3]Guess it makes sense that I never saw her, then.
No one else did either, at least until today.
\pop[3]I mean, that's kind of a big question.
Because of my vision, I'm never really alright.
I'm always just waiting until the next time it happens.
\pop[3]They gave me some pills, though, and I make sure to take them.
They're supposed to calm me down, and stop me from dreaming.
\pop[2]Oh, that's right. My counselor said that visions are basically dreams.
\pop[2]I suppose if you could suppress those, then things would be alright.
\pop[2]But I have a feeling he's developed a dependency on those pills.
\pop[2]I have a sudden flashback to our time at the Triple R.
\pop[2]Those gummies he had, gave him a "dreamless sleep" as he put it.
\pop[2]Perhaps there were better alternatives than those pills.
\pop[3]It can get really hard sometimes, you know?
The vision could come at almost \c[14]any\c[0] time.
\pop[3]But my old manager gave me this scarf when I told him about it.
Sometimes, when it happens, I grab at my neck in real life.
\pop[3]I can never pull the rope off my neck in the vision.
But when I tug on the scarf, and it comes loose, sometimes the vision ends.
\pop[3]I guess it's a way of tricking my body to snap back.
It doesn't \c[14]always\c[0] work, but it tends to come in handy.
\pop[2]Come to think of it, I've seen him playing with his scarf a lot.
\pop[2]Has he had his vision right in front of us, and we didn't even know?
\i[3]"Of course. You can ask me anything."
\i[3]"Of course. You can ask me anything."
\pop[3]Well, the vision makes it really hard to live a normal life.
There are days where it can get really, really, rough.
\pop[3]On days like that, I just wish it would happen already.
Does that make me a bad person...?
\i[3]"I don't think you should wish for something like that."
\i[3]"No. I'm not sure that I could handle it, either."
\i[3]"I don't think you should wish for something like that."
\i[3]"No. I'm not sure that I could handle it, either."
\pop[3]A lot of people can't. I tried looking for a support group before.
But my label wouldn't let me go. People would gossip, or something.
\pop[3]Anyway, I hope things make a bit more sense to you.
They upped my dosage before letting me take this break.
Something about wanting to avoid a "public incident".
\i[3]"Yeah. I understand a lot more now."
\i[3]"Yeah. I understand a lot more now."
I know he would've fought for me.
But since I'm all alone, I usually just do what they say.
\pop[3]"We know what's best for you" is their most common excuse.
I know they just want to make money off of me.
At least my old manager had \c[14]heart\c[0]...
\pop[3]That's the \c[14]one\c[0] thing you need in a business like this.
In a sea full of greed, kindness really stands out.
\pop[3]Did I ever tell you how I met him?
\pop[3]Well, he approached me after that talent show.
Wanted to organize my transfer to a new school.
My family obliged, and we started planning the move.
\i[3]"Sounds like he really believed in you."
\i[3]"Sounds like he really believed in you."
He proved it \c[14]every\c[0] opportunity he could.
\pop[3]Also, I had a best friend when I was in school.
His parents were best friends with mine, too.
\pop[3]When it came time to move, they wanted to move as well.
I was actually really happy. I wouldn't have to lose my best friend.
It was a long drive, and I convinced his parents to let him come in our car.
\pop[3]So there we were. All four of us.
It felt like we all had the \c[14]world\c[0] in our hands.
But when you do, it always finds a way to slip through your fingers.
\pop[3]I was the only one who survived the accident on the way there.
I just remember waking up in a hospital bed, in a world without them.
\pop[3]His parents found out pretty fast, of course
They came to visit me, and I was actually \c[14]hopeful\c[0].
If anybody would take care of me, it would be \c[14]them\c[0].
\pop[3]But I saw nothing in their eyes, except resentment and hate.
They told me I deserved a bunch of awful things, and left me there all alone.
Apparently, it was my fault, just because I wanted to sit beside my friend.
\pop[3]Everything felt hopeless for me at that point.
I lost everybody, and I was cursed with this vision.
\pop[3]But then my manager came to see me in the hospital.
He held my hand, saying that he'd take care of me.
\pop[3]And he did. Up until the day that \c[14]he\c[0] died, too.
That's when I started negotiating new contracts, and this hiatus.
\pop[3]He actually had the incident scrubbed from the internet.
That's when we came up with this stage name, and left my old life behind.
\pop[2]Right. He mentioned that Klace wasn't his real name.
\pop[3]I \c[14]do\c[0] miss my old name, though. Pretty badly.
I can still hear my friend calling it out every time he saw me.
Sometimes I think that part of me died with them in the accident.
\i[3]"If you'd like your name back, I'll happily use it."
\i[3]"If you'd like your name back, I'll happily use it."
\i[3]"Of course. You deserve to be called what you want."
\i[3]"Of course. You deserve to be called what you want."
\pop[3]Promise to keep it between us? At least for now?
\i[3]"Absolutely. What would you like to be called?"
\i[3]"Absolutely. What would you like to be called?"
\pop[3]Honestly? I'd tell you to take your pick.
\pop[3]It started out as William, and then people called me Will.
Will turned into Bill for some reason. I \c[14]hated\c[0] that one.
But eventually that turned into Billy, and it stuck.
\pop[3]They always said it was the name that keeps on giving.
But if I had any say in the matter, I'd choose Will, or Billy.
\pop[2]He laughs, and a big smile appears on his face.
\pop[3]It sounds so \c[14]weird\c[0] to hear it after all those years.
But thank you, Delta. From the bottom of my heart.
\pop[2]He steps forward, and kisses me softly on the cheek.
\pop[2]He opens his arms, and I give him a big hug.
\pop[3]There is one more thing I wanted to talk about, though.
\pop[2]He walks to the cabin door, and locks it, before turning around.
\pop[3]I know you read my diary, Delta.
Did a pretty bad job of covering your tracks.
\pop[2]I immediately lock up in fright, and the energy in the room changes drastically.
\pop[3]There's only \c[14]one\c[0] thing I have to say to you about it.
\pop[3]I don't know how to explain it, but it really helped me out.
Made it a lot easier to open up to you just now.
\pop[3]You understand a little more than the others outside.
And in my situation, that makes a world of difference.
\pop[2]He steps forward, until he's close to me again.
Actually, I consider it the end of us.
Actually, I consider it the end of our friendship.
\pop[3]But, it's also the start of something new.
\pop[3]That's the thing about burning bridges, Delta.
It's the only way we can build \c[14]new\c[0], even \c[14]stronger\c[0] ones.
And nobody says they can't lead to the same place as before.
\pop[3]Also, I \c[14]was\c[0] gonna kiss you on the lips.
But I decided to downgrade to the cheek.
Let's call it even for what you did to me.
\pop[2]I shrug, and tell him that's fine with me.
A new start to our friendship, with more understanding.
Now that you know my secrets, I \c[14]know\c[0] it'll bring us closer.
\pop[2]I nod. A stronger bond sounds better to me.
I'm \c[10]dying\c[0] to see what Isaac does next.
\pop[2]It may be unintentional, but that could also be a \c[14]really\c[0] dark pun.
\pop[2]I guess it doesn't matter, though. I nod, and we head toward the door.
\pop[2]He unlocks it, with a loud click, and then looks back into my eyes.
\pop[3]You ready to see how this all plays out?
\i[3]"As ready as I'll ever be, Billy."
\i[3]"As ready as I'll ever be, Billy."
\pop[2]He smiles at me, with a slight scoff.
\pop[2]Then, a moment later, we're back into the night.
\pop[2]The campfire illuminates my friends, and our final destination.
\pop[2]I guess this was the end of our journey.
